abstract: In preparation for sixth phase of the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP6), a new set of global gridded land-use forcing datasets are being developed to link historical land-use data and future projections in a standard format required by climate models. This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
